one_reviews_text: I was sceptical at first, played it during 2-3 minutes and exited. Big mistake. Second time around I had a bit more patience and boy was it worth it! A very, very good VR experience. Not really a game, more like an interactive animation, but one of very high quality. Highly recommended especially if you are new to VR!
Lovely 360 RT3D storytelling
Excellent animation, very cute characters and funny as well.
Absolutely beautiful.
Short scripted story but very beautiful and fun to play.
if it had a little bit longer gameplay it would be more fun
Top quality visuals, acting. Great little story
very good!
Thanks a lot for great story! Watch it many many times!
Fun but needs more
Really good everything

The graphics, storytelling, voice acting, atmosphere was the best I've scene. It's more detailed than a textureless experience we usually see, and not live action.  It's a shame I can't find more experiences like this. I only watched it on the Quest so far. 

Tip: The 3D makes it a tiny bit blurry for me, so I turn it off by clicking the menu on a part of the movie I'm not watching, and the rest of the area becomes 2D smooth.

review_title: Like being inside a Pixar film
one_reviews_text: Delightful story that creatively interprets Native American fable. This is my first Baobab story and I'm going to find them all. It's amazing this one is free, but I'[m happy to pay to support such excellent work.
A really lovely short VR animated story.  Entertaining and beautiful telling of a native american legend.  Thank you for this =)
So immersive, the environment is fun and colorful. The story is well thought out and the game well made.
And this is for free?! I normally don't like movies, but the quality is so good of Crow. Well done
It's a free experience - how can you complain. The graphics are STUNNING... such a cool one. Loved it.

Thanks for this Masterpiece it is build from the ground up in everything perfect.
Crystalclear Graphics and Sound.
VR Motion very smooth.
Hope we get more like this in the next time.
Maybe full  1 0r 2 hour VR Movies in the Ice Age or Minions Universe where you 
live inside and can do a little more interact like in Asteroids.
Would pay a lot if this happens.
Thanks again.

Crow is just fantastic artistic storytelling of a tale been past down for generations. Fantastic art and likeable characters make this interactive video a must watch.   Perfectly lengthed with a catchy soundtrack makes for a 10/10 experience.
The narrator sounded kind of lazy, but outside of that, it's a real nice experice. Definitely worth checking out.

WHAT a SURPRISE enjoy :)
kids will love it
This is beautiful.  I like the Native American folk tale.  Worth the time.
the story line and animation of the characters was amazing! i felt like it was real life.

review_title: Awesome free VR film with interactivity
one_reviews_text: Good animation, great sound effects and character voice acting. Definitely worth your time to experience.
Beautifull art, great story, super inmersive and lovely done.
I never expected that this will be this good. Amazing work!
The graphics look stunning, the storyline was ok, but after the 5 minutes of this I was hoping for it to end real soon. The storyline got boring.
This was a joy from start to finish. Don't want to say anymore than that since this should be experienced without knowing what it's about. Highly recommended.

review_title: A beautiful crow shows his true colors
one_reviews_text: A very heart warming experience. It's free, about 20 minutes long, and interactive! I wouldn't miss out on this one.

Awhh I don't even have the words! It was a beautiful experience/story from start to finish. I laughed, I cried and I even danced along with all of the creatures in this story. I highly HIGHLY recommend this! ♥
Not a game, but a heartwarming story with great animation.
Really fun to chill but gets boring after a while
Amazing story, graphics, vocals and suprisenly even gameplay...

This is a magical interactive story about a magnificent crow and his friends.
Skunk,Turtle,moth and owl.
You portray as the spirit of Seasons. 
One day you decide to make the first winter there ever is and the relm crow and his friends live in beacome so cold...
What will the ever do?

Have just watched the entier story and even streamed it to one of my friends so we could watch together. it was absoloutly spectactular. well done  and a standing ovation to baobab for their work and design in this story.
I was left in nothing but ore. and wanting to clap. Next one to watch is invasions. really looking forward to it. Hopefully you guys shall see another review from me.
If you have self doubt or don't feel good, play this.

Before The Crow, I could not imagine that a 3D cartoon VR experience could be so heartwarming, charming and magical. Fantastic Voice Over actors, and ingenious VR storytelling puts you smack dab in the middle of one of the most beautiful native american classic tales.

This is so wonderfully animated and charming.  And with only the slightest bit of blasphemy included!  

9/10
I tried the demo on psvr and it sucked,this on oculus just blew me away! My wife loves it!

This is a heartwarming tale about some forest animals and absolutely worth watching. My only grievances are that sometimes when the scene would cut, you'd have to spin around to find the direction you should be facing next. There is some forced interactivity to the film as well as you are expected wave your hands around every so often which feels unnatural. But the story itself is awesome and family-friendly with a good lesson.

Everyone in our household took the time to participate in this story.  I use the term participate loosely because it is 100% scripted and really only depends on how fast you wiggle the controllers.  Regardless, it is a great sneak peek at what is possible for interactive storytelling, and all of us thoroughly enjoyed it.
A creative and magnificent adventure

Native American stories are so often brilliant in their simplicity and beauty, and this one is no exception.

The VR experience is delicate, but involving, and the characters are well modelled, well voiced and feel utterly real.

I was drawn in from the moment I launched the story, and enjoyed it to the final note!
Lovely VR experience with a hint of interaction. Very recommended.

Wasn't expecting much, the preview video doesn't do it justice, this is simply brilliant, a great little 20 min tale with well written and voiced characters, you'll get drawn in despite yourself, just download it, be a kid again for a while.
The best interactive narrative in VR I've seen. There is so much more to explore.
i got totally lost in this beaitfully animated world that comes with a great message. It is a must watch.

This mindblowing experience/movie is one of the best I have ever experienced. I have been using the Vive and Oculus for 3 years now and have NEVER come across anything so magical except literally a handful of titles, and this one definitely takes the top! I will be trying other Baobab experiences for sure. Again, I cannot iterate how amazing this was, it was like being in a Disney movie!! VR is amazing!!

review_title: By far the most magical experience in VR
one_reviews_text: I felt in love with this story. The animation is so good, the inteactions ar so magical  it feels like you are in another universe. Good work Baobab.

I'm in awe at how emotional this made me feel. It seems catered towards kids from the preview, but it's actually really fun for adults too. It makes you just want to dance like a kid again. If you're hesitant, don't waste any more time!
The most interesting cartoon VR I've ever seen.
Great video for anyone who wants discover VR especially for kids.

review_title: Didn't expect to like this so much.
one_reviews_text:
The interaction and visuals really are stunning.
Dunno why i liked this so much.

Not the greates story/writing for adults but I don't think anyone will think it wasn't worth experiencing.
Veyr nice!

review_title: The new VR movie reference for all ages!
one_reviews_text: Great story - feels much like a Pixar production - and the graphics quality is flawless (it's super-polished like Henry, thus this movie is of the highest professional quality). Using a GTX 1080 I could crank up super sampling to 2.0 and still get solid 90 fps, so this app is greatly optimized. Sound/voices/music, story and graphics were all perfectly made, you can't go wrong with this movie - and maybe best of all, it's free. Compared to similar VR movies, the duration is quite long - about 20 to 25 minutes. Unlike The Bond, this movie is perfect for (young) kids - well, it's probably mostly made for young kids, but their parents will have an awesome time watching this movie too :-) BTW, in some scenes there're interactions using Touch, still it's something quite easy to do even for young kids. The movie can be enjoyed sitting, but I'd recommend to watch it standing - at least when watching it for the first time.

Amazing!
Highly recommended!
Amazing !!!

review_title: The Next Evolution In Story Telling
one_reviews_text: I didn't expect to like this as much as i did, I like the idea where you as the player actually have a role in the story. I hope more of these type of stories become available in the near future.
Definitely worth checking out. This has a lot going for it. A little boring sometimes.
This was a blast! Funny, heartfelt, and beautiful!

Colorful amazing interactive experience...
Music, acting and worlds are amazing!
The idea of interacting with the movie is nice!
A bit long compared to other short movies... 
Does not detect position properly but all in all its Great!

review_title: This is what a vr movie should look like
one_reviews_text: I liked this movie. Its a interactive movie, where you get to be a part of the movie.
Flawless execution. I would expect no better from Pixar or Dreamworks.

review_title: I'M A DEAFIE: Please add subtitles
one_reviews_text:
Hello!

Five stars for the graphics/concept of immersing yourself to witness a Pixar style movie in an environment.   But there are no subtitles so I can't follow along with the story.

Also, Oculus Store needs a "Subtitles: Yes / English" field in the list of features.  Steam does this, and so should Oculus.  

Some innovation will be needed in VR subtitles (e.g. chat balloons above characters, or floating traditional subtitles under them, or some other technique) but we should not set a precedent to have no subtitles for the deaf, hearing impaired, and hard of hearing.   

Oculus adding a "Subtitles: None" vs "Subtitles: English" field to the features list will help.  (P.S. I am a software developer, and adding subtitles is not hard).

review_title: Worth much more than they're asking
one_reviews_text: Just started using VR, and getting my feet wet with rpg, shooter, and puzzle games.  The story is done very well, and the graphics and voice acting were immersive. Not too interactive, but just enough to feel you were part of the story.  I would have gladly donated $2-3 for it... and something that I'll watch again. I hope they do more stories.

I started playing, expecting a cute two or three minute animation. I did not expect a professionally made short film with the Native American legend of crow. Which I won’t spoil in case you don’t know it. But it’s one thing to read about it or even see a film of it. It’s an entirely other thing to be part of crow’s story. Well done!
This just looked very stunning and i like you had to wave your hands in certain scenes. Not what other films typically do! GREAT FOR NO COST

One of the best things ive seen in VR. EVERYBODY should see this, top notch visuals & a nice story. Kids (& adults) should love this.
Highly recommended.
So well done, great VR film making.
Just excellent. Great story, wonderful artwork and masterful VR staging. The user interaction is so cleverly implemented and so beautiful too.  Setting the bar for VR 'movies'.
This is such a cute story with BEAUTIFUL art work and animation plus a lot of interaction! The whole time I couldn't stop smiling! :)

I'll be honest. This short film put big smiles and some tears of joy on my face.
The storyline, the animation, the song... Everthing was beautiful and polished.
I just wish there were subtitles in portuguese so that I could show it to all my friend.
Congrats! Well done!

Absolutely beautiful.  This is probably the best use of VR as a story telling tool that I've seen yet.  When the developers gave the opportunity to subscribe to their mailing list after the movie was over (something I'd normally find offensive), I didn't hesitate.  I absolutely want to know what they do next.

This was a fun and entertaining story. ive given it four stars because the imagery looked a bit too stylised (grainy?) at times and things didn’t feel like solid objects you could reach out and touch. Also, sometimes there were scenes that made you feel disconnected from the world you were standing in.

Otherwise brilliant... and for free!
This short film is great done i relay enjoined being part of it.
Amazin cartoon!

this is a really good piece of work and artwork spot on .. hope there more to come in the way of film like this .. did enjoy where i did some things and was in some way made part of story .. but that not always needed .. just sitting back and watching a film  in this format is just as good .. will still hit the mark .. you should look at a much longer film and you should start asking for money for these .. getting stuff for free .. is awesome .. but i would like to see that your able to do more and money pay for much more and ables you to buy better tool for the job of creating these out of the world films .. i've always wanted to see a film from this view point and you have made that possbile .. thank you :)

I don't regret downloading this film. So inmersive and... I have to be honest, I cried a bit in some points. I'm overwelmed by this piece of art. Please, Baobab Studios, produce more things like this jewel. 
Thank you.

PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE DOWNLOAD IT!! You won't regret it! Then come back and thank me by hitting the "like" on this review so that others may be convinced. This is amazing work! Coming from someone who is all about downloading hardcore action games with intense graphics. I never knew I would be writing a review on a "kiddy movie" but this is simply too beautiful and such a great experience! I really hope they'll produce more, I would pay for it! Simple graphics and simple story but beautifully integrated story-telling with interaction. You'll feel like Elsa from Frozen, literally! This is a great direction for future VR animated movies. If only we can watch all the animated films with interactions like this. 6-STARS!!

review_title: Magnificent. A must watch for VR'ers
one_reviews_text: Beautiful art, animation, effects and music. Perfect direction; they have gotten the art of directing your attention around in 3D space down to a T. And a lovely story taken from Native American folklore.
A must see short movie, that unfortuneately has completely incoherent framerates on the characters.

I had already tried this on the Go where it is already a great experience, and on the Go it is of course a film, a video.   When trying this one on the Rift I was very surprised to realize that it is fully rendered real-time VR, not a video, and looked just as good as the pre-rendered film on the Go, if not better!   Little bit of interactivity and interesting hands.   Good techniques for directing your attention, and of course a good story.   Well done Baobab!

This feels like a great free short film with a decent story and animation and excellent voice actors. The crow is amazing. This is a must for children but adults can enjoy it at well. They could have charged a dollar if they wanted but so glad they didn't.

Its a must see experience for everyone. It officially dethroned Henry as go to app to show to my kids. The level of polish is incredible and art truly breathtaking. My only smallish gripe would be strangly choppy animation on fast moving objects but its maybe me :)

review_title: Doesn't hold up on its own merits.
one_reviews_text:
The story might've been interesting, even fun, had it not been presented so straight-faced.
The interactivity feels forced.
The character and environment design is... A little weird.
Animation's solid, (and strangely seems to run at 24FPS, but whatever.)
Voice acting sounds good and works well.
I don't have too strong an opinion on the sound design.
The presentation is well done. It does a good job of guiding your eyes when needed, and leaves little ambiguity about what's happening.

Would only reccomend if you're looking for novelty.

I hate to do it, but a one star is what this gets, but only due to the movie crashing every five minutes of play. I liked everything else about it, but I can't show this to family and friends when it consistenly crashes during the show. It ruins the entire experience when I have to restart it five times and skip scenes. I'm using a 1070Ti with a core i5 8600k, if that helps anything.
Cant believe its free.  Guess if you have Oprah on your side, you must have plenty of funding hah. Loved it.

It was entertaining, I really liked the art and I believe it does a good job in diplaying the potentiality of VR for animation movies. The effects, the voice acting, the animation, the art, the colors, and the pace of the story, everything is good. Since it's a free experience it deserves 5 stars even tho considering the good results achievable with VR for animation movies, I wish that more complex and deep experiences would be available for VR enthusiasts rather than short samples or stories.

I've seen several short stories in VR, most are fantastic - if a little short.  I knew Baobab Studios from their previous VR short Invasion!, which came out at around the same time the Rift launched.  Invasion! was brilliant - but Crow the Legend is orders of magnitude better.

Not only is the animation better, the story more meaningful, the acting/voiceovers fantastic, but the look and feel of the production is Pixar quality, and the length is much longer.  This allows for a more nuanced, impactful story.  

It's crazy good.  It's free.  Just try it!

review_title: This is not VR. It's a linear 360 video.
one_reviews_text: This is not a VR experience; it's a 360 degree video. A perfect example of a modern-day Hollywood animation studio doing what it does best but absolutely in the wrong medium. Hollywood doesn't understand VR. This has no interaction (waving arms, really?), no room presence, no feedback, no social component, no building/saving, no sense of self-presence (no visible avatar, no consistent perspective) no internet connectivity, almost no use of the microphone or controls... This is just watching a movie, which is better done sitting in a chair, sharing some popcorn with family and friends in front of a nice screen. To be fair, the animation, graphics, frame-rate, polish, and sound-design is on par with other Hollywood animation movies--but that doesn't matter; it's not VR. I would rather watch a screen, which has been carefully framed by directors, than have to hunt around looking for what I'm supposed to be looking at, while an animation plays on, in completely linear, non-interactive, movie fashion, regardless of what I'm doing. No amount of Hollywood celebrity attachment, earned "Award" marketing, paid reviews, bug-free polish, or even free distribution makes up for the fact that this is literally hackneyed animation studio, song-n-dance stuff, which has been around for decades. It's the same old stuff. You may not even sit through if it was on DVD. Believe me, I wanted to love this. It could have been great. Anyone who has had to sit through lengthy "cut scenes" on a videogame, for example, would understand the critical and missing amount of potential here. Calling a basic linear Hollywood animation a VR experience is like calling a book a board game. If you want to stand for 20 minutes and swing your head around and virtually do nothing else but wave your arms around when prompted while looking at an animation, here you go. If you want a true virtual reality experience, you may not want to waste the time downloading and sitting through this.

I had to rip apart three massive walls made of Stone to feel manly again after I watched this Masterpiece of Art. It´s an amazing short Film with great and smooth Musical talents, like John Legend who lend his voice to one of the characters. You have to check it out, you just have! It is totally worth it!

I´m not a native english speaker, so please excuse grammatical errors mistakes.
Best Regards

I tried it as a dad and i really liked it. I gave my daughter the chance to play it and she always want to play it  now! She likes being able to create magic with her hands like snow and fire! She also like being able to move around these little creature! She even tried to hug them! Overeall 5 fives it is really worth it for every occasion. It can be a VR intro! It's perfect for kids! Happy dad here!
Funny :) !

review_title: Wonderful Retelling of a Classic Tale
one_reviews_text: I experienced "Crow, the Legend," on Oculus Go and it was amazing. I was constantly swiveling in my chair to follow the action and I didn't get the least bit nauseated (I get severe motion sickness). I will watch it again to catch what I missed when turning to try and catch everything. It's a wonderful world Baobab has created. Can't wait for the next one!

Fantastic Movie. Great for kids and adults that enjoy an animation and a movie you'll want others to watch too.
The use of the interactive element is subtle and well done and really make a difference in the whoole experience.
(Stay till the credits and wave your hands around too!)

This experience is VR!
I had only a couple of experience that showed me why VR is so great. This title just shot to its Number 1 spot on my list of item when I want to explain why VR is the future. This put me right into my childhood memories, when I was playing Pirates or Explorers and truly believe it. Do buy it and show the developer some love.
Great experience with fun interaction. Amazing music which suits everything going on. Highly recommended!

review_title: The future of movies and entertainment
one_reviews_text:
While a movie will always be fun to sit down and watch, I think this pushes film in the right direction. Especially for kids. It's just the right amount of participation, it doesn't ask much of the viewer but it still acknowledges their presence which I like very much.

The story itself is well done and the acting and animation is pixar quality. I especially like how it got your attention by vignetting your screen in the direction of the "Action".

Overall, I'm astounded by the quality and am excited for their next project.

I downloaded this on a whim as it was free, and when I finally got around to watching it I couldn't take my eyes away for the whole movie. The quality of the animation itself is absolutely top notch, this is easily content you would expect from a brand new feature film release, with wonderful characters and colours and lovely design style. The VR component primarilly works to put you there, and really feel like you're inhabiting this world - I was craning my neck in my seat to follow the action as it moved all around me. The use of hand presence will undoubtedly be a big hit for children watching this, using their hands to control the seasons, but it's also quite fun as an adult - conducting a space opera is pretty darn sweet!

There's really no reason not to download this, a so many reasons to give it a go. Go on, you won't be disappointed.

An excellent production - voice acting, music, graphics, everything was very well done. Plus a little bit of interaction from the viewer. VR takes this kind of media to a new level. Imagine watching Toy Story in VR, etc. 

It's free, so no real reason to forgo watching this. But it would be worth paying for.

Ok so it seems there isnt many others that noticed but the antimation on some of the charcters in certain scenes red bird at start for example) is very choppy like its running at a ower frame rate then it should and it ruins it for me. when compared to fluid animation on other characters its very noticeable
Deliciosa experiencia con una animación muy cuidada y llena de detalles. Bonito cuento. Solo está en inglés, pero el doblaje es muy claro y limpio.
I can't find words. Amazing story, amazing animation and style. Love it!

Overall, this is a good story that lasts about 23 minutes.  The cartoon style and the effects that go with it are very nice.  The narration sounded a little disjointed right at first, and it sounded a little odd for the main character to be singing in what sounded like a small, hard surface room instead of the forest he was pictured in... but in the land of make-believe, things aren't supposed to necessarily make sense.  You will play a small role as one of the supporting characters, but I didn't grasp why that was needed.  I started to watch the story from a chair, but found it easier to be standing so I could enjoy the entire atmosphere.  I did enjoy the storyline, and they gave credit to the Native American origin of that story.  Overall, nicely done.

It's stories like these that can show VR can be a great medium for story telling. It's art style is beautiful and the characters are lovable. I quickly forgot where I was and just fell into the story. Wonderful work and worth checking out.

@ AbledBody thank you for being the only reviewer who also noticed it looking like 24fps at times, so many PC owner and didn't see that. I also found it weird that it seem to effect only one character at a time. Maybe this is a cache saving technique but I noticed lag instantly from anywhere in a VR world. I feel like this was a nice attempt though but I was turned off by the whole lag situation (50% headroom and then some) it was definitely the animation and not performance of my hardware (gtx 1080ti, I7 6700k, 32 gig ddr4 2133, 5500 gb ssd) Let me know if you fix those issues in the animation and I will complete the story. I would still say this is a step in the right direction..... Soon enough Wreck it VR Ralph.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wZeYmhobzOY (Please Note: Links from Oculus may not be working so please search YouTube for 'Paradise Decay VR Crow: The Legend'

My Quick Thoughts:
WOW this is amazing and for the 1st time in VR I felt like I was stepping into an interactive cartoon and it just blew me away.
There is also a GO version of this experience but people have been telling me it's not as sharp, just  a video and not interactive.
I feel the Oculus Rift version is the better version to experience as it's all in real time and super clear.
I have found my next showstopping experience to show newcomers the magic of VR.

There have been others who've tried out VR as a linear storytelling medium and some were quite enjoyable, but I've never seen a production team that has actually put together a lot of prefessional resources to mastercraft a story that has completely made me a believer of VR storytelling, until now. This story completely stands out from the rest of all VR stories and you simply can't miss the glaringly obvious fact that this narrative has received the royal treatment: The script writing, set design, character design, lighting, acting, animation, shaders & textures, interactivity, voices, music all simultaneously overwhelm in their awesomeness. If all these resources have been pooled together to create this masterpiece to make people believe in VR storytelling, then you have done it! I've been a strong believer of the VR technology for long. Now, you've made me believe in VR storytelling!!

Like mentioned in other reviews, some of the animation is unfortunately far from 90fps. However, the experience has some beautiful scenes that showcase the scale of things in VR. It's a bit of a drag but definitely worth at least one watch even for adults - since it's free.

Great expirience on many levels. Certainly enjoyed the length and the time taken to tell a good story. Polished look and feel! You can tell that there have been some talented people working on it and I hope the team working on this will bring us more in the future. I ran this on a MSI laptop with a Gtx 1060 without problems. The source of the story was inspirering and I hope that more like this would be made into a VR story. Our world holds so many of them and exploring them in VR gives us a chance to engage and learn from these myths and folk tales up close.

was really a good moment (and I'm not a fan of this sort of games).
The only thing I could demand is to introduce a set of language with some subtiles for who don't speak english

One of the best visuals I have ever experienced in VR.  Highly recommend that you watch this…
I would have happily paid for this.  The only trouble being I probably wouldn't have thought that it was for me, being a horror and FPS fan.  I just wish that kids could enjoy VR; this is the perfect medium for entertainment for all ages.

When I opened the game the menu alone looked amazing, and you get thrown into it immediately with amazing designs and colors. The interactive part was amazing as well, sometimes I just kept waving my arms around cause it was just so fun. The story was amazing, funny, and taught a really good lesson in the end. To summarize this thing up, good story, good designs and art, good everything!!! I LOVE IT!!!!

I enjoyed every moment of this.  The camera direction is intuitive, the voice acting is charming, the animations are vibrant and engaging.  And the simple immersion (which I didn't even expect in a VR video) works well to make you feel like you are playing a part in this Native American legend.  I'm subscribed now to updates for future movies by this developer and I can't wait to see what they come up with next.

This was probably the best VR experience i've had in this genre (Non game). It has more depth than previous short films, both length and interaction wise. Coupled with great animation and voice acting this is 10/10. Thank you for making such a great piece free of charge!

This is what you want in a VR Movie.  its a Short (ish) VR story any age will enjoy.
This is So well made. Professional animation, Professional acting and Professional writing. 
Baobabstudios, your team should be proud.
For the love of God add to download for free or pay say £5 and support creative production team.
I would happily pay for this experience!
Thank you for make this! Keep it up, I will give you a year before disney snaps you up... lol ;-)

review_title: VR has a new precedent for storytelling
one_reviews_text: This was so beautifuly done! A masterpiece for its time. I only hope that the cost of the experience (being free) does not drive false expectations for future audiences! This experience would have been well worth $10 - $20 . Let's hope we see more stunning content like this, released in high volumes, to grow the VR market!

review_title: Well, THAT was a perfect experience.
one_reviews_text: This was a beautiful, and beautifully executed, animation/experience.  You forgot you were in VR and you were IN the story.  It takes subtlety and flair to manage this kind of emotion manipulation, and this gives me great hope for VR in the future.  If anyone says that VR is on the way out: then this kind of thing will convince them that, well, we are at the dawn of a beautiful new media.  Absolutely stunning. Thank you.

This story is full of heart and soul. The sound and the visuals complement each other perfectly plus there are some delightful interactive affects. This deserves a place in everyone's collection. VR is most definitely good for more than just playing games, and here's proof.

Get it. Watch it. Spread the word!

review_title: A new high bar in VR storytelling
one_reviews_text: When I saw "Oculus Studios" collaborated with this title I knew I was in for another treat but this was just amazing. If anyone had doubts about a full length feature in VR this is how you can do it.  It's only about 30 mins long but it was a masterful job.  Voice acting and animations were pretty much on par with typical animated features.  There was no clunky robotic movements.  All the characters looked and felt alive. It's amazing that this is free! Looking forward to more features from Baobab Studios!

What a wonderful short story.  This is certainly one to keep in my pocket to show family and friends.  VR is so amazing and not all of us with nice systems want zombies and killing.  To sit back and be entertained for a few minutes is truly enjoyable.  Keep it coming devs!   Your doing a great job.

The whole experience is just under 20 minutes. It's beautifully animated and voiced by a great cast with a very cute story.  It's something children and adults will love.  Looking at all the other reviews tells you all you need to know.  It's free, so you have nothing to lose!

Maybe the best semi-interactive storytelling VR work. The story works subtly and covers a lot of ground for the short and very enjoyable duration of this most exellent peice. I will be sure to share with family.

This is such a great experience. It is the first movie like experience that really worked in VR. The images and animations are crisp and clean. The audio is fantastic. The story and interactions are fun. Thank you!
Short but sweet. A wonderful short. I really enjoyed it. Looking forward to trying it on the GO as well. I hope there are more like this, Great job John!
What you are seeing in screenshots is actually the real time experience! Must be one of the best short stories ever produced for VR!

I'm surprised that this  VR-movie IS FREE!
Everything about this is superB!
The animation.
The lighting.
The locations.
The voices!
One of my first experiences in VR.  It was quite amazing to be inside the story as it unfolds.  The story, voice acting, software performance, everything was great!
Amazing
Man what an amazing experience this was.  The story telling and the attention to details relit the imagination I wonder I once had for VR. I'm glad I got to be part of such a great story
...at a great price. Free. Good production quality.
Great story and visuals, the only downside is that it's too short. Please make full-length movies for VR one day!! If this is a short version of what they could be, I'm so excited.

review_title: A Must Watch for any vr user
one_reviews_text: I never had interest  in the movie side of vr and what it was capable of, but this high quality, interactive short film has changed my mind alot. The best part is that its freaking FREE DOWNLOAD IT !!!

review_title: This is THE VR movie experience
one_reviews_text: The future movie watching experience will be in VR, and this short film paves the way for it. Very well made, interactive (for a movie), and great graphics and visuals.

review_title: a vr movie actualy worth seing
one_reviews_text: great short interactive film about a 25 minutes of great voice work and trippy art design puts you right in the middle of an addorable story  that is a great thing to show off vr to freinds and family.
cute little video great for the kids
I didn't expect much and I was pleasantly surprised! Please give this a watch, it's a fantastic story and had me feeling like a kid again. Children will love it!
This is a milestone for VR video. This is top quality. One thing wasn't perfect: temporal aliasing (noticable stuttering during fast movement). This is a animated short for children. Show it to them.
The characters are lovable and the story is cute. With some mild interactive hand-waving moments, the game is otherwise a short film about a crow and his friends.  Highly recommended.
VR at its best ... wonderful , can't wait to try another one from those guys ! <3
...but kids will love it I suppose. Oh, and someone reviewed saying this is not VR and that it's a 360 video. It IS VR. 360 videos are flat/2D and are just that, a video.

Just watch it brother and sister.....it's so good!!
Finaly a short animation with a good lenght of 25-27 minute.
Not those short teaser like 2-4 minute that we use to got!!
This is a masterpiece! It was NOT short compared to most films in VR. The visuals were stunning, and the story was very engaging! I would totally recommend this to pretty much anyone! :D
Amazing experience.  I've re-watched it many times now and I can't get over how great the story and visual quality is.  Definitely recommend!

MORE MORE MORE I love everything about it!!
Love the story 
Love the animation
And love the way you interact with things :D
10/10
Absolutely stunning, the future of entertainment.  It's a perfect app to showcase the possibilities of VR to newcomers.   And it's free!   What are you waiting for?
Just watched Baobab Studio's "Crow: the Legend".  Guys, that's the future of the movies. And it is almost now! Baobab, thank you!

review_title: This is how to do it
one_reviews_text: Amazing short film! If my kids had cartoons like this when they were younger, I would have never seen them out of VR. We need more like this. Great quality, interactive and engaging.
Very adorable little animation, I wish you could snap using the controllers instead of physically having to turn though.
A beautifully realised  and gloriously animated short VR interactive story.  Loved everything about it!
wonderfull story!! I want more movies like this! So cute! <3

review_title: Beutiful graphics but boring as hell
one_reviews_text: I only lasted about 5 min before I had to shut it down.
The production quality, voice and songs are top notch.  John Legend was the perfect choice.  An important story to bring to the VR medium.  Bravo.
Im not really a critic I just belive that this was a wonderful experiance. You have noting to lose to play this game and everything to gain.
But it is a bit of a boring story, I think this is aged at 5-7 year olds but then I don't think Vr a good idea for those so young.
This is one of the best short animated stories I've seen yet in VR! I absolutely loved it! Can't wait to show my nieces and nephew soon... WOW!

Probably the best non-game experience ive had in the Rift.
Great animations, fx and art. Amazing work!
This story is one of my favorite experiences to date.  It's long, has a small amount of reactiveness to you, and beautiful... what a great experience!
I enjoyed this short film, although it is geared more toward kids.
Amazing visuals and a great story.  This is going to be my new default for showing VR to new people.

Would be great portuguese language, my kids will love too!
Congrat dear friends!

review_title: The Crows in Dumbo make sense now.
one_reviews_text: Such a woven demonstration of story telling and interaction. A new favorite to show off to new vr users.  More Please! (will pay)
This is what vr is about ! Great movie ! Would pay for content like this !

Worth every second of my time.
At the end song i was even dancing in my chair.
Waiting for more to come.

review_title: Just like being in a short Pixar movie!
one_reviews_text:
But this movie is 24 minutes. AMAZING!
Story, graphics, interactivety, voices... this ineractive move has everything. A must see.
Great animation! Tells a very interesting story, with good detail and music. We need more like this
great!
Nothing to add other than if anyone questions the quality & significance of VR, show them this.
More of these kind of "movies". It was an awsome experience
I almost teared. That is the furture of animation, and the best version of it!
This is the best VR experience i had to date.
I feel like i just experienced the birth of a new medium. Beyond movies, tv, etc...

review_title: Time flies when you're having fun!
one_reviews_text: One of the best (free) experiences on Oculus Home!
Just take 10 minutes and experience this.
Just the most charming and well animated piece i've seen in VR yet.
Now THAT'S a 3D movie!!  I think we are seeing the future.  The NEAR future!
It was lovely dont forget to wave your arms a lot. God Bless
Absolutely wonderful...great story, wonderful graphics, immersive and cute!
Wonderful quality and story.  Excellent!
One of the best short experiences in ages - go and watch it now.
Absolutely amazing!
Nice texture, beautiful story. Congratulation!

review_title: Best VR Story Experience So Far
one_reviews_text: This is the second best VR story experience after Henry
I make it short ....... Amazing experience.
You've got absolutely nothing to lose.
Highly recommend.

review_title: Wow! How is this free? It's awesome!
one_reviews_text: Great experience! Thanks a ton!
Simply the best short VR Animation so far...
Great experience, great song, great voice.
Long story short: must watch.
just amazing
Really well done  <3 <3 <3
Must download. Just do it already.
NEED TO SEE THIS!
This is amazing!
Just a fantastik narrative
A must watch.
Nice animations!
nice
Its a game!@!!!!1

This movie is so amazing. And the experience is even greater! I love being able to be a part of this story, especially one that is making a difference in storytelling for animation. This is such a stepping stone for virtual reality, as well as diversity and inclusion in entertainment.

Great job, Baobab Studios!

Any time I've seen animation this polished in VR, I expect that I can only watch it, but not here. Crow goes much farther to deliver more than just a narrative experience. I loved when magic effects flowed out of my hands to bring the forest to life at the very beginning. It feels amazing!

I do really love the graphics, the character and environment design of this Dreamworks like production. In this VR experience I feel really like being into the story, close to the characters as if I were myself there with the characters. What's adding into the immersive experience is the fact that we can interact sometimes with the 2 magical branches in our hands. I wish we could trigger more events in the story. The only thing I'm hoping is that we could also have a french version with dialogues based on European culture. 
What makes also the magics here, in an immersive way, is the Spatialized sound design and quality. Everything works together to make us live a nice poetry.
Well, I would dream to experience the movie "How to train your dragon" this way!
RcgtFfcfsd
Doesn't do anything new, but is a pretty nice ride, specially for kids
It represents the future of animation movies. A masterpiece!
